messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/31/03 4:45:47 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
rjhill241@... writes:

> Since I am on this new quest for fresh foods...can anyone tell me why I am
> getting nats so badly in my kitchen, even though I wash my fresh fruits and
> veggies the moments I get home? They gross me out, but I don't have room in
> the
> fridge, but if I did would that make a difference?
>

First let me say sorry for spelling errors!!! Gnats.

Anyway after posting this I decided to google why and where gnats comes from
and clicked on this link:

http//www.mountainwings.com/past/3093.htm

It was very synchronistic considering the last week or so of all the lists
discussions. So I thought some of you might want to read it. I never thought
gnats could have a profound meaning until just now.

Rhonda - who still doesn't like gnats

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Gardening / thanx Sandra was:Purposes of lists
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/31/03 1:13:48 PM Pacific Daylight Time, ... Thanx Sandra!!! Hey everyone!! I m in the high desert of So Cal, very dry, rock country. Our
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/31/03 1:13:48 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:

>
> <<Maybe I should try cherry tomatoes, cuz I love 'em and maybe they
> will feel sorry enough for me, that they will actually take root >>
>
> If you're in a naturally humid and wet place, maybe.
>
> If you're in a dry place, tomatoes need a lot of water.
>
>
Thanx Sandra!!!

Hey everyone!!
I'm in the high desert of So Cal, very dry, rock country. Our weather is
always extreme, because my home is also near the base of a mountain, also. So hot
is extremely hot, cold is extremely cold, and winds are horrendous when they
come. Funny we talked about tomoatoes today in this thread, because said uncle,
"the gardener" in my earlier post, came by with tomatoes both big and cherry,
and some funky little yellow ones too, and three perfect looking zucchini.

Since I am on this new quest for fresh foods...can anyone tell me why I am
getting nats so badly in my kitchen, even though I wash my fresh fruits and
veggies the moments I get home? They gross me out, but I don't have room in the
fridge, but if I did would that make a difference?

TIA!!!

Rhonda


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
